wdm 0.2.4

Computing weighted ranks

Source: R/rank_wtd.R
rank_wtd.Rd

The weighted rank of \(X_i\) among \(X_1, \dots, X_n\) with weights \(w_1, \dots, w_n\) is defined as $$\frac 1 n \sum_{j = 1}^n w_i 1[X_j \le X_i].$$

rank_wtd(x, weights = numeric(), ties_method = "average")

Arguments

x

a numeric vector.

weights

a vector of weights (same length as x).

ties_method

Indicates how to treat ties; same as in R, see https://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/base/html/rank.html.

Value

a vector of ranks.

Examples

x <- rnorm(100)
w <- rexp(100)
rank(x)
#>   [1]  26  52  57  37  96  97  29  33  56  21  46  62  68  14  51  95  19  79
#>  [19]  15  35  49   4  38  76  23  94  84  34   8  12  27  92  25  73  47  65
#>  [37]  43  83  98   1  44  45  93  31  72  30  39  11  99  13   3  22  81  66
#>  [55]   9  90   2  20  10  74  80  67  48  77  75  78  50  28  55  53  36  88
#>  [73]  91  58  59  17  70  86  18  87  89   5  63  60   6  32 100  71   7  16
#>  [91]  41  82  61  42  54  69  64  24  40  85
rank_wtd(x, w)
#>   [1]  27.61205857  54.81319316  59.73893926  40.36396788  98.97630661
#>   [6]  99.32965598  30.13372035  33.15654256  58.19530003  20.98218690

#>  [21]  51.24975861   0.95328299  41.61480565  73.99855688  23.67000865

#>  [31]  29.22131516  91.69500146  27.39885292  69.34398301  51.10834196
